intro: Manulea indica, commonly known as the Indian manulea, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
